name: Dumbbells on Preacher Bench
how_to_perform:
1. Sit down on the preacher bench, placing your upper body against the pad with your arms at shoulder height and holding dumbbells.

2. Ensure your hands are pronated (palms facing down) and gripping the dumbbells firmly with a shoulder-width overhand grip.

3. Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your thighs by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary against the bench.
4. Focus on using only your shoulder muscles to lift the dumbbells, keeping your core engaged and maintaining control throughout the movement.
5. Lift the dumbbells up and back, extending your arms and contracting your deltoid muscles.
6. Lower the dumbbells down to the sides of your thighs, repeating for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Dumbbells on Preacher Bench is an effective isolation exercise for targeting the lateral deltoids in the shoulders and can be used as a variation of traditional lateral raises.
